intro: Hieracium mougeotii subsp. benthamianum, commonly known as the Bentham's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and flowering heads. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological traits, including leaf shape and flower structure.
